sceneContext: First meeting between the two main characters at a friend's wedding. They've been seated at the same table and have just discovered they work in competing firms that are bidding on the same major contract.
currentDialogue:
"I didn't catch your name," she said, taking a sip of champagne.

"Michael. Michael Chen," he replied. "And you?"

"Sophia Rodriguez." She extended her hand. "Nice to meet you."

He shook her hand, holding it a moment longer than necessary. "So, Sophia, what brings you to Jen's wedding?"

"College roommate. You?"

"The groom is my cousin." Michael looked at his plate. "Small world."

"It is," she agreed, then hesitated. "Wait... Chen. You don't happen to work at Meridian Partners, do you?"

Michael's smile faded slightly. "I do, actually. I'm their lead architect on the Westlake project."

"No way," Sophia said, putting down her glass. "I'm the design director at Innovations Group."

"The competing bid," Michael stated flatly.

"Yes."

"Well, this is awkward," he said, forcing a smile.

"Very," she replied.
